meanings.definition: An act of changing physical location or position.
meanings.sent1: The cat's quick movement caught the mouse by surprise.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the movement of the leaves as the wind blew through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The movement of the toy car around the track was both entertaining and fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movement on the dance floor was like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The slow movement of the glacier over time carved out the valley.

meanings.definition: A group of people working together to advance their shared political, social, or artistic ideas.
meanings.sent1: The civil rights movement fought for equality and justice for all.
meanings.sent2: The environmental movement aims to protect our planet for future generations.
meanings.sent3: The book club movement in our neighborhood has brought together avid readers.
meanings.sent4: The movement of actors in the theater troupe was synchronized and powerful.
meanings.sent5: The feminist movement has made significant strides in promoting gender equality.

meanings.definition: A series of organized activities working toward a particular goal.
meanings.sent1: The student movement to improve campus facilities gained momentum.
meanings.sent2: The movement to raise funds for the charity event was a great success.
meanings.sent3: The movement of volunteers cleaning up the park was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The movement of workers in the factory was efficient and well-coordinated.
meanings.sent5: The movement to promote healthy eating habits in schools is making a positive impact.
